business.headline: Sebi fines Anmol Ambani Rs 1 crore for lapses in Reliance Home Finance case Sebi also fined Krishnan Gopalakrishnan, the Chief Risk Officer of Reliance Housing Finance, Rs 15 lakh.
Only 7% of F&O traders made profit in last 3 years, says Sebi studyAccording to the Sebi study, 1.13 crore retail traders in F&O markets collectively lost Rs 1.81 lakh crore during this period.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Key takeaways from DRHP, NTPC share price targetNTPC Green Energy aims to raise Rs 10,000 crore through this public issue, which will consist solely of a fresh issue without any offer-for-sale component.
Sensex ends nearly 400 points higher, Nifty above 25,900The S&P BSE Sensex was down 384.30 points at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 148.10 points to settle at 25,939.05.

X user highlights API flaw in DotPe, removes post after legal noticeAccording to tweets shared by social media users, DotPe's entire API was left public, meaning anyone could access sensitive information without any authentication.
'This is India's moment': Nvidia's Jensen Huang after meeting PM Modi in USNvidia CEO Jensen Huang was one of 15 tech leaders who met with PM Modi during his visit to the United States.

KRN IPO: Key details of Rs 340 crore public issue from Rajasthan farmer's sonThe IPO of KRN Heat Exchanger is the journey of Santosh Kumar Yadav, a farmer's son from Tijara, Rajasthan, from a small town to leading a major manufacturing company.
Should you subscribe Manba Finance IPO: Check GMP, price band, detailsManba Finance IPO: The IPO is fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.
Is Warren Buffett's cash pile costing him billions in missed gains? Warren Buffett has amassed a cash reserve of about $280 billion after selling shares in companies like Apple and Bank of America.

Riding high on IPO listing gains? Here's why you should book profitsRecent IPOs have brought impressive gains, but do those initial highs really last? Investors might want to think carefully about when to cash in on their profits.

GST rate rationalisation: GOM to discuss slab, rate tweaks on September 25The meeting, which will take place in Goa, is part of the ongoing efforts to streamline and rationalise the GST structure. This panel, known as the Group of Ministers (GoM), is led by Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary.

Cochin Shipyard, RVNL, IREDA among 7 PSU stocks in ASM framework. Details hereThe ASM framework classifies stocks based on several parameters, including price volatility and delivery percentages, aiming to encourage caution among investors.
BHEL shares gain 2% after winning Rs 6,100 crore project from NTPCAt 10:35 am, BHEL's stock was trading at Rs 271.25, reflecting a gain of 1.92%, on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Reliance Power shares soar 5% to upper circuit for 4th straight day. Here's whyThe rally in the company's shares follows the announcement of a board meeting scheduled for September 23, 2024, to discuss a significant fundraising proposal.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares jumped nearly 9% today Vodafone Idea shares surged sharply in early trade after the company made an announcement regarding a $3.6 billion deal. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time highs as bulls dominate Dalal Street The S&P BSE Sensex climbed to an all-time high of 84,843.72 moments after opening, while the NSE Nifty50 rose to 25,910.35.

Netflix India being probed over visa violations, racial discrimination: ReportNetflix's former director of business and legal affairs for India, Nandini Mehta, said she was pursuing a lawsuit in the US against Netflix for alleged wrongful termination as well as racial and gender discrimination - charges the company denies.

Succession Wars: Inside Murdoch family's fight for power and control of Fox NewsThe Murdoch family, one of the most powerful media dynasties in the world, is currently engaged in a bitter battle for control of their media empire.

NPS Vatsalya: 9,705 minors sign up on Day 1. Here's how to invest for your child?The scheme, overseen by the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), is part of the National Pension System (NPS) and aims to help parents and guardians begin retirement savings for their children from an early age

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Badlapur rape accused shot dead in police custody after firing at copsAkshay Shinde snatched a police officer's weapon and opened fire at the cops. The officials retaliated, during which he sustained critical injuries.

274 dead in Lebanon as Israel strikes Hezbollah targets in fresh offensiveThe announcement came shortly after Israel began what it stated was a fresh round of "extensive strikes" across Lebanon and suggested that Tel Aviv was gearing up for another round of conflict.

Nirmala Sitharaman clarifies remarks on EY staffer's death: Not victim shamingUnion finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman responded to Opposition's accusations of "victim shaming" over her remarks on the death of a 26-year-old chartered accountant at Ernst & Young (EY).

Sri Lanka now delivers a political earthquake in India's neighbourhoodMarxist Anura Kumara Dissanayake has been sworn in as the new President of Sri Lanka. His election is a political earthquake as Sri Lankans have rejected entrenched parties and handed power to a non-elite for the first time. Interestingly, he gave a new direction to the JVP, which fought two armed wars against security forces.

Indian women mix of submission, dominance: Laapataa Ladies Oscar citation slammedThe Film Federation of India described Indian women as people who are a "strange mix of submission and dominance" in an official document about Laapataa Ladies' Oscars entry. The citation has not gone down well with many.

Cop who shot Badlapur rape accused has worked with top encounter specialistSanjay Shinde has previously worked with the anti-extortion cell of the Thane Police Crime Branch, then headed by IPS officer Pradeep Sharma, who was known as an 'encounter specialist'.

Pushpa producer denies Allu Arjun's involvement in choreographer Jani Master casePushpa producer Ravi Shankar refuted claims of Allu Arjun and filmmaker Sukumar's involvement in the Jani Master sexual assault case, stating that the matter is personal to Jani Master and the alleged victim.

6-year-old boy kidnapped from California in 1951 found alive 70 years laterLuis Armando Albino was playing with his older brother in 1951 when a woman kidnapped him on the pretext of buying him candy. Albino's niece took an online DNA test in 2020 "for fun", which showed a 22% match with a man who turned out to be her uncle.

Millennials and Gen Z are greying at an alarming rate. Can you reverse it?Premature greying has become a worry for both millennials and Gen Zers. In addition to modern lifestyle factors, environmental elements such as pollution are also key contributors.

Tried my best: Donald Trump assassination suspect wrote letter detailing plansRyan Wesley Routh, accused of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump at a Florida golf course, left behind a note expressing his intent to kill the former president. Prosecutors revealed new details, including a handwritten list of Trump's upcoming appearances, as evidence of a planned attack thwarted by the Secret Service. Routh is currently in custody, facing federal charges.

Success lies in our collective strength, not on battlefield: PM Modi at UNPM Modi, who is in the US on a three-day visit, addressed the Summit of the Future at the UN General Assembly, and said for global peace and development, reforms in global institutions are important.

Take credit for bringing chess to Indians' attention: Viswanathan AnandLegendary Indian chess player Viswanathan Anand said that he is proud to play his role in expanding the chess culture in India and keeping the sport relevant for many years. Anand's comments came after many credited him for setting the groundwork for India's Chess Olympiad gold medal in 2024.

More wins than loses: Tracing India's incredible Test cricket journeyNinety-two years after CK Nayudu's men played India's first Test against England at Lord's in 1932, Rohit Sharma's team achieved a historic milestone. With their victory over Bangladesh in Chennai, India now has more wins than losses in Test cricket for the first time. Let's dive into India's journey in Test cricket.

Exclusive: Kiran Rao talks about Laapataa Ladies' road to Oscar finaleDirected by Kiran Rao, Laapataa Ladies is India's official entry for Oscar 2025 in the Best Foreign Film category. In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Rao spoke what the film's nomination means to her, husband Aamir Khan's reaction after the announcement. She also spoke about how they plan to campaign for the film, leading to the Oscar finale.

California sues oil giant ExxonMobil over misleading public on plastic recyclingCalifornia Attorney General Rob Bonta filed a lawsuit against ExxonMobil over its alleged role in global plastic waste pollution. He alleged that the oil giant has been misleading the public about plastic recycling.

Centre's notice to a ghee supplier for Tirupati temple amid laddu row: SourcesThe Food Safety and Standards Authority of India has issued a show cause notice to AR Dairy over allegations of supplying adulterated ghee for Tirumala laddus.

Why Israel's pounding of Lebanon won't destroy Hezbollah | Explained in 5 pointsIsrael has asked people to evacuate areas where Hezbollah operates in Lebanon. These are the five factors that make the Sia terrorist organisation a resilient outfit that Israel won't be able to wipe out despite all the intel and firepower.
India reports first case of mpox from new, fast-spreading clade 1b varietyThe patient is a 38-year-old man who had travelled from the United Arab Emirates, Kerala authorities had said last week.

Bengaluru woman's murder suspect identified, over 30 pieces of body found in fridgeKarnataka's Home Minister, G Parmeshwar, confirmed that a suspect in the Mahalakshmi murder case has been identified in West Bengal, with efforts ongoing to arrest him.

Railway staffer detained for stealing detonators, setting them off in Madhya PradeshTen detonators triggered a small explosion on a track in Madhya Pradesh, briefly halting a military train on September 18. A railway staffer has now been arrested for stealing the detonators.

Can vitamin C supplements lead to kidney stones?High doses of vitamin C supplements can increase the risk of developing kidney stones, particularly calcium oxalate stones, while dietary sources remain safe.

Secularism a European concept, not needed in India, says Tamil Nadu GovernorTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi criticised the concept of secularism in India, calling it a "fraud" and a European notion not relevant to the country. He argued that secularism was wrongly introduced into the Constitution during Indira Gandhi's tenure to appease certain sections of society.

Donald Trump backs IVF, Kamala Harris talks guns: Party lines shift in electionThe race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump has blurred traditional party lines as both candidates adopt policies that appeal to the opposing party's base. Harris is focusing on gun ownership and border security, while Trump is pushing for credit card interest caps and IVF coverage.

Pakistan appoints Lieutenant-General Asim Malik as new ISI chief: ReportThe reported move comes as the political role of the agency faces intense scrutiny. One former ISI chief has been arrested for supporting the political cause of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan.

Pushpa producer denies Allu Arjun's involvement in choreographer Jani Master casePushpa producer Ravi Shankar refuted claims of Allu Arjun and filmmaker Sukumar's involvement in the Jani Master sexual assault case, stating that the matter is personal to Jani Master and the alleged victim.

Jr NTR's Devara opening day ticket prices hiked in TelanganaThe ticket prices of Jr NTR's Devara have been increased in Telangana, with extra shows added to meet the high demand. The film releases on September 27.

Actor Chhaya Kadam on Laapataa Ladies' Oscar entry: It's a moment of prideActor Chhaya Kadam reacted to Laapataa Ladies' Oscar entry. Speaking to India Today Digital, she called it a "moment of pride" for her and the film's team.

Arjun Kapoor to Kareena Kapoor, celebs at Malaika Arora's father's prayer meetMalaika Arora's father, Anil Mehta, died on September 11. A prayer meet was held at a gurudwara in Mumbai, which was attended by Mehta's family members, Arjun Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor Khan, and others.

sports.headline: Mohun Bagan complete Durand revenge after tense 3-2 win over NorthEast UnitedMohun Bagan Super Giants completed a dramatic 3-2 comeback against NorthEast United in an ISL thriller at Salt Lake Stadium, with Jason Cummings' late strike sealing the win after a controversial equalizer by skipper Shubhashish Bose.

Vishy Anand bumps into Gukesh after Chess OlympiadChess legend Viswanathan Anand shared a humorous moment with young grandmaster D Gukesh at Budapest airport after Gukesh's second Olympiad gold win. Anand, full of praise, sees Gukesh as a future World Championship contender.

Pat Cummins focusing on keeping 'gamechanger' Rishabh Pant quietAustralia Test captain Pat Cummins said that he was focused on Rishabh Pant ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Pant made a sensational Test comeback against Bangladesh and is expected to be crucial in India's success Down Under.

Rishabh Pant vs MS Dhoni, Ashwin-Jadeja role in home dominance Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's stunning Test century against Bangladesh reignited debates about his standing among India's greatest keeper-batters. In the Sledging Room Podcast, experts discussed whether Pant could surpass MS Dhoni as India's top Test wicketkeeper-batter.

Emotional Daniel Ricciardo 'teary-eyed' in potential goodbye from Formula 1Former Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo was emotional after the Singapore GP. The driver was teary-eyed knowing well that the race could have been his final one in Formula One career.

From 'Nanha' to star: How Pro Kabaddi League transformed Narender's lifeIn a small village in Haryana, a young boy nicknamed 'Nanha' spent his days watching older kids practice kabaddi. Little did anyone know that this curious child would one day become one of the sport's rising stars.

Bring pride back to Pakistan cricket: Gary Kirsten demands 3 vital changesPakistan head coach Gary Kirsten has demanded three major changes in Pakistan cricket after Day 1 of the Connection Camp arranged by the PCB. In the camp, the management and select players sat down together to discuss the roadmap for cricket in Pakistan.

Maharashtra govt allots Bandra plot unutilised by Sunil Gavaskar to Ajinkya RahaneThe Maharashtra cabinet approved a 30-year lease transfer of a 2,000 sq. meter Bandra plot to cricketer Ajinkya Rahane to develop a sports complex. The land was previously allotted to Sunil Gavaskar, who returned it after decades of non-utilization.

R Ashwin reveals Virat Kohli's surprise after seeing Chennai Test crowd on Day 1Ravichandran Ashwin revealed that Virat Kohli was surprised seeing the turnout of the Chennai crowd on the morning of Day 1 of the 1st Test between India and Bangladesh. However, the crowd later turned up in big numbers to support the Indian team.

Ashwin recalls age banter with Rohit Sharma after wife's hilarious questionIndia spinner R Ashwin shared a humorous exchange with Rohit Sharma about their age during India's dominant Test win over Bangladesh. Ashwin's stellar all-round performance led India to a 280-run victory, earning him consecutive Player of the Match awards.

Coach Gautam Gambhir is a 'relaxed rancho', everybody will love him: R AshwinIndia vs Bangladesh: Speaking after his all-round heroics in the Chennai Test, off-spinner R Ashwin highlighted the difference between 'relaxed' Gautam Gambhir and 'organised' Rahul Dravid. Gambhir tasted success in his first Test assignment as head coach on Sunday.

Ancelotti reveals desire for longer stay at Real Madrid: I love this jobCarlo Ancelotti, ahead of his 300th game with Real Madrid, expressed his desire to continue with the club, despite fans speculating if his 2026 contract expiry will also mark the end of his illustrious managerial career.

India's dominant Chess Olympiad win reminds Viswanathan Anand of Soviet teamsChess Olympiad 2024: Speaking to India Today, legendary Viswanathan Anand said he was lost for words to contextualise India's dominance in the men's section in Budapest. India won the gold medal with 21 points, four more than their nearest rivals. The women's team also scripted history by winning gold.

Gukesh favourite to clinch World Championship vs Ding Liren, hints Vishy AnandD Gukesh is the favourite to win the World Championship against Ding Liren hinted legendary Viswanathan Anand. Speaking to IndiaToday in an exclusive interview, Anand said that Gukesh is performing at a much higher level than the rest.

Shakib was 100 percent fit before Chennai Test: Bangladesh selector Bangladesh Cricket Board selector Hannan Sarkar confirmed Shakib Al Hasan was declared fully fit before the Chennai Test, despite speculations of injury. Shakib's struggles with the ball and bat raised concerns after Bangladesh's heavy defeat to India.

Barcelona injury crisis deepens with Ter Stegen set for tendon surgeryBarcelona's injury crisis deepened further after captain Marc Andre ter Stegen suffered a complete rupture of his right knee tendon on Sunday, September 22. Ter Stegen is set to have surgery before going into rehabilitation.

Billy Bowden and Suresh Raina reunite, recreate the 'crooked finger' gestureUmpire Billy Bowden shared a special picture on Instagram featuring Suresh Raina as they reunited and recreated the iconic 'crooked finger' gesture.

Bernardo takes shots at Arsenal after City stalemate: Rivalry is differentBernardo Silva took a subtle jab at Arsenal after Manchester City's intense 2-2 draw at the Etihad, calling out the club's lack of trophies compared to City and Liverpool, and suggesting Arsenal played for survival, not victory.

Steve Smith hails Jasprit Bumrah as best all-format bowlerAUS vs IND: Senior Australia batter Steve Smith hailed Jasprit Bumrah as the best all-format bowler in the world. Bumrah is expected to be India's main weapon against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
I will never play with that bat; it is a big gift from Virat Kohli: Akash DeepIndia pacer Akash Deep has revealed that he will never play with the bat gifted to him by star India batter Virat Kohli.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
